VirtueelGeheugen.Simulation

Class Process

  • java.lang.Object
    • VirtueelGeheugen.Simulation.Process

  • public class Process
extends java.lang.Object

    A model representing a process. Each process is assumed to be able to have 16 pages and will get a page table to facilitate 16 pages. Each process contains:

    • The id of the process.
    • A page table.
    • An interface connecting the process back to the RAM.
    • The amount of times the process has written a page to the RAM.
    • The amount of time a process has written back pages to the persistence memory.

      • addPagesToMatch

        private void addPagesToMatch(int present,
                             int address,
                             int accessTime)
        Method to add pages until the process completely fills it's allowed space.
        Parameters:
        present - The amount of pages currently present.
        address - The address of the page that has to be put in RAM
        accessTime - The current time of the clock.

      • removePagesToMatch

        private void removePagesToMatch(int present)
        Method to remove pages until the amount of pages currently in RAM does no longer exceed the allowed limit.
        Parameters:
        present - The amount of pages currently present.

      • removePage

        private int removePage()
        remove the LRU page from RAM. Increase the amount of pages written back to the persistent memory if the page has been changed while it was in RAM.

      • addPage

        private void addPage(int page,
                     int accessTime,
                     int frame)
        Method to be called when adding to add a page.
        Parameters:
        page - the page number containing the address of the instruction being called.
        accessTime - The current clock time.

      • accessPage

        private PageTableEntry accessPage(int address,
                                  int accessTime)
        Used with a read or write to get a page from RAM or move it to RAM if it is not in RAM.
        Parameters:
        address - The address the page has to contain.
        accessTime - The current clock time.
        Returns:
        The PageTableEntry for that page.

      • getLastUsed

        public int getLastUsed()
        Method to find out when the process was last used.
        Returns:
        Time when the process was last used.

      • scalePagesToFit

        public void scalePagesToFit(int address,
                            int accessTime,
                            boolean prepage)
        Sets how many pages of the given process are currently in RAM. If 0 is specified all pages will be removed from RAM. If there are too many pages currently in RAM, the excess will will be removed from RAM. Otherwise pages will be added that follow the last used page. If a page is newly added to the RAM, the time it was last accessed is set to the current clock time.
        Parameters:
        address - The address in the first page that has to be put in RAM.
        accessTime - The current time of the clock.

      • removeAllPagesFromRAM

        public void removeAllPagesFromRAM()
        Call when removing process from RAM.

      • write

        public void write(int address,
                  int accessTime)
        Call when a write operation occurs.
        Parameters:
        address - Address to be written to.
        accessTime - The current clock time.

      • read

        public void read(int address,
                 int accessTime)
        Call when a read operation occurs.
        Parameters:
        address - Address to be read from.
        accessTime - The current clock time.
